intro: Scandicium stellatum var. hebecarpum, commonly known as the star-shaped scandicium, is a rare variant of the scandicium stellatum species. It is characterized by its distinctive star-like foliage, with leaves arranged in a radial pattern. The plant exhibits a compact growth habit, often forming dense clusters of foliage. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically appearing in late spring to early summer. This variant is primarily found in specific alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions.
